creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: garden scene: large garden pond in foreground with island and trees; reflections of garden trees and landscape in pond; pavilions, trees, shrubs, and blooming trees in background; three white swans in pond at LLC; self-published
inscription: L margin, printed: 自摺　昭和八年作　庭四題　春之朝 {jizuri, Shōwa hachinen saku, Niwa yondai, Haru no asa}
markings: in pencil, LRC margin: 134 | LRC of image, printed vertical rectangular red relief seal: Hiroshi | two embossed seals LRC margin | label: Ann and Ed Robinson label | LRC mount: Blocks: 12, Impressions: 38
medium: Woodblock print; ink and colors on paper
portfolio: From Four Garden Scenes (Niwa yondai 庭四題)
signed: signed LRC, in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida | signed LRC of print, in print: よし田 {Yoshida} | title printed LLC margin: A Garden in Okayama
title: A Garden in Okayama on a Spring Morning
